Documentation.UserDocu: With this objects you can handle constraint sketches
solve the actuall set of geometry and constraints
add a geometric object to the sketch
addHorizontalConstraint(GeoIndex[,name]) - add a horizontal constraint to the geometry with the given index
addVerticalConstraint(GeoIndex[,name]) - add a vertical constraint to the geometry with the given index

addPointOnPointConstraint(GeoIndex1,PointPos1,GeoIndex2,PointPos2[,name]) - add a point on point constraint to the geometrsie with the given indexes You give two element idexes and the type of point you whant to use 0 = StartPoint, 1 = EndPoint, 2 = MiddPoint (in case of an arc or circle)

movePoint(GeoIndex,PointPos,Vector) - move a given point to another location. It solves the sketch that way the point stais at the given location or fail. This methode is somewhat tricky. If the move is to bigg it can fail to find a valid solution. It can work if you move the point over some iterations to the target. This methode is mostly used to allow the user to dragg some portions of the sketch in real time by e.g. the mouse.
